definition.name: CC-NPSPACE
definition.formal: Problems solvable by nondeterministic O(poly N) round protocols

savitch.statement: CC-NSPACE(r(N)) SUBSET CC-SPACE(r(N)^2) for all r(N) >= log N
savitch.proof_summary: Configuration graph reachability via recursive midpoint search

equality.proof_summary: poly^2 = poly, so CC-NPSPACE SUBSET CC-PSPACE

tradeoff.statement: Simulating r-round nondeterministic protocol requires O(r^2) deterministic rounds but only O(log r) additional state per node
tradeoff.proof_summary: Quadratic round blowup, logarithmic state increase

alternation.proof_summary: Alternating poly = nondeterministic poly = deterministic poly

hierarchy_update.before: CC_0 < CC-NP < CC-PH < CC_log < CC-PSPACE < CC_exp
hierarchy_update.after: CC_0 < CC-NP < CC-PH < CC_log < CC-PSPACE = CC-NPSPACE = CC-AP < CC_exp

fault_model_effects.key_insight: Nondeterminism is orthogonal to fault tolerance

new_questions_details.question: Is there a tighter simulation than O(r^2) for specific problem classes?
new_questions_details.description:
Savitch gives O(r^2) rounds. For some problems, can we do better?
Are there subclasses where nondeterminism can be eliminated with
only O(r log r) or even O(r) round blowup?

new_questions_details.question: What is CC-NLOGSPACE? Does CC-LOGSPACE = CC-NLOGSPACE?
new_questions_details.description:
Savitch also shows NLOGSPACE in DSPACE(log^2 n).
For coordination: CC-NLOGSPACE in CC-SPACE(log^2 N)?
Does the analog of Immerman-Szelepcsenyi hold?

new_questions_details.question: Can Savitch's simulation be made fault-tolerant?
new_questions_details.description:
The basic Savitch simulation assumes reliable execution.
Can we make the simulation itself Byzantine fault-tolerant?
What's the overhead for fault-tolerant Savitch?

new_questions_details.question: Is there a coordination analog of Immerman-Szelepcsenyi?
new_questions_details.description:
Classically: NLOGSPACE = co-NLOGSPACE (surprising equality).
For coordination: CC-NLOGSPACE = CC-co-NLOGSPACE?
This would show complementation is free for log-round protocols.

new_questions_details.question: What is the relationship between CC-AP and CC-PH more precisely?
new_questions_details.description:
We showed CC-PSPACE = CC-AP (alternating polynomial).
CC-PH has FINITE alternation depth.
What exactly is the gap? Is there a CC problem requiring
exactly k alternations for each k?

summary.key_result: Nondeterminism provides no additional power for poly-round coordination
summary.significance: Savitch's theorem transfers to coordination complexity
